qas.question: During which year was the federal government unstable?
With which type of government did Ortiz replace the old one?
Which new governor was arrested by Ochoa and Bustamente?
Who now headed the civil and military authorities?

answers.text: J. A. Pescador and Simón Ochoa

context: Because of the general instability of the federal government during <a0_0>1828<a0_0/>, the installation of the new legislature did not take place until the middle of the following year. It was quickly dissolved by <a1_0>Governor Santiago de Baca Ortiz<a1_0/>, who replaced it with a more pronounced <a2_0>Yorkino<a2_0/> type. When Guerrero's liberal administration was overthrown in December, Gaspar de Ochoa aligned with Anastasio Bustamante, and in February 1830, organized an opposition group that arrested the new governor, <a3_0>F. Elorriaga<a3_0/>, along with other prominent Yorkinos. He then summoned the legislature, which had been dissolved by Baca. The civil and military authorities were now headed by <a4_0>J. A. Pescador and Simón Ochoa<a4_0/>.
